view

Class PhotoDirectController

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.PhotoDirectController

  • public class PhotoDirectController
extends java.lang.Object
    When an album is other all photos in the album will be shown here. All photos will be displayed in thumbnail form type ImageView. Each ImageView is assigned an id generated from the the url of the image and the id is linked to a Photo object of the image containing all information associated with the image.
    Author:
    Pedro Cruz

                       javafx.scene.Scene previous,

      • addImage

        public void addImage(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Adding a Photo is activated when the user clicks the "add" button. Users dictory is opened and the user must select an image, should the image not be of type acceptable, then an alert will be displayed. Should the photo already be in the current album, then another alert is shown. Stating that the album already contains the photo. If successful, the the photo is added and it is displayed on the displayed side; there the user can add caption, tag(s) and key(s).
        Parameters:
        e -

      • previous

        public void previous(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Always active, allows the user to go to previous photo in the thumbnail display panel. The slide show pigbacks from allPhotos and subphotos; subphotos are the current search results in display. This is done when the user clicks on the left button of the display image.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • advance

        public void advance(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Same as the previos button, allows the user to go to the next photo in sequential order by clicking on the button to the right of the image display view
        Parameters:
        e -

      • save

        public void save()

      • recaption

        public void recaption(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        When the caption/recaption button is clicked the caption field is enabled allowing the user to make changes to the caption, initially the caption is empty. Once the recaption/recaption button is clicked changes are updated to the Photo object
        Parameters:
        e -

      • addTag

        public void addTag(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        When the user clicked on the add Tag button, the String entered in the textBox is read and should the tag name already exists in the current Photo, an alert will be shown. Otherwise the tag selection will be updated to include the new tag. Tags are in decending order. For user convenince.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • addKey

        public void addKey(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Upon clicking on the addKey button the information entered by the user in the textbox to the left of the button will be read, should the key already exists in the selected tag, an alert will be displayed, otherwise the key will be added and the list will be updated
        Parameters:
        e -

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        For user convenience a choicebox of all album associated to the user are displated. Once a user has selected a photo, an album in choice box, and clicked on the move button, selected photo will be move to the selected destination. Should the user fail to follow that sequence an alert will pop stating the corresponding error.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • search

        public void search(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Upon clicking on the search button, the user input for dateSearch will be pulled, should it be in inproper order the search will fail. An alert will be popped. Otherwise photo's corresponding to the date search will be shown in the the thumbnaiil panel
        Parameters:
        e -

      • showThumbNails

        public void showThumbNails()
        Generated an array of imageview, sizing them to thumbnail size

        public void showKeys()
        shows the observble list of keys used for search

      • deleteKey

        public void deleteKey(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Upon selecting a photo and clicking on the delete button, the user will delete the selected photo. With it the user will also deleted all tags and key relation associated with the photo.
        Parameters:
        e -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • pastePhoto

        public void pastePhoto(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Upon clicking on the paste button, the copy (Photo object) will be pulled from the user. Should there be nothing, or the photo already exists in the album an alert will be posted. Otherwise, tags and keys will be updated to include the photo.
        Parameters:
        e -
